title: Relativistic hydrodynamics with phase transition
abstract: arXiv:2309.14773v2 Announce Type: replace  Abstract: Assessing the applicability of hydrodynamic expansions close to phase transition points is crucial from either theoretical or phenomenological points of view. We explore this within the gauge/gravity duality, using the Einstein-Klein-Gordon model, a bottom-up string theory construction. This model incorporates a parameter, $B_4$, that simulates different types of phase transitions in the strongly coupled field theory existing at the boundary. We thoroughly examine the thermodynamics and dynamics of time-dependent, linearized perturbations in the spin-2, spin-1, and spin-0 sectors. Our findings suggest that "hydrodynamic series breakdown near transition points" is valid exclusively for second-order phase transitions, not for crossovers or first-order phase transitions. tldr: 该文章提出并在强耦合场理论边界的gauge/gravity duality框架下验证了一种新的方法，该方法使用Einstein-Klein-Gordon模型来模拟不同的相变类型。研究表明，在第二类相变附近，传统的hydrodynamic expansion（渐近自由能）会失效，而对于第一类相变和 crossover，这个结论不成立。此外，关于模型中的时间和温度，原始作者并未提及具体的温度范围或相应的物理意义。在一系列图像和分析中，原作者详细讨论了不同类型的相变，并在不同类型的相变中得到了不同的结论。
